page.title: 12CHARLTON-HANK.ECOLOGY 2
page.content: Hawthorn,Blackthorn,Hazel,Ash,Willo w,Sycamore,Field Maple,Oak,Beech, Conifer,Rowan,Elder,Holly,Viburnum Dog Rose,Bramble,Ivy,Clematis,Bryony, and some regeneration of Elm are commonly found in hedgerows and copses.Woodlands support three species of Woodpecker,Nuthatches and several species of Tits,Chaffinches and Wrens. Summer migrants include the 6 common Warblers,House Martins,Swallows. Sand Martins,Spotted Flycatchers and Yellow Wagtails have declined.There are Rooks,Crows,Jackdaws Jays and numerous Magpies whilst predators include Little,Tawny and Barn Owls, Kestrels and Sparrowhawks. The more common Thrushes and Finches occur in the hedgerows and garden as well as Wood Pidgeons,Collared and Stock Doves.Mallard,Moorhen nest by ponds & streams,visited by Heron & Kingfisher.
